text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to point out the employee's risks if wrongfully employed in Italy, specifically mentioning the crime of illegal stay regulated by Article 10-bis of Legislative Decree No. 286 of July 25, 1998 (TUI), with fines up to \u20ac5,000 and administrative deportation. The candidate answer discusses the need for a VISA/work permit (Section 5) for a UK national working in Italy, stating that a permit is mandatory under both Option A (Direct Italian employment) and Option B (UK subsidiary employment/posting). However, it fails to mention the specific legal consequences (crime of illegal stay, Article 10-bis TUI, fines, deportation) associated with *wrongful* employment or lack of proper documentation, which is the core requirement of this criterion.", "criterion_id": "c1df7e99-a6b4-4eb1-8646-a2afb157c21b"}
